verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I know my love by his way of walkin', And I know my love by his way of talkin', And I know my love dressed in a suit of blue, And if my love leaves me, what shall I do?

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: And still she cried, "I love him the best, And a troubled mind sure can know no rest." And still she cried, "Bonny boys are few, And if my love leaves me, what shall I do?"

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: There is a dance house in Maradyke And there my true love goes every night. He takes a strange one upon his knee And don't you think now that vexes me!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: If my love knew I could wash and wring, If my love knew I could weave and spin, I'd make a coat all of the finest kind, But the want of money leaves me behind.
